exercise: text = 'apple banana cherry'. Split this string into a list of words.
sentence = 'Hello, World!'. Split this string at the comma.
numbers = '1 2 3 4 5'. Split this string into individual numbers.
text = 'Python is fun'. What is returned when you split this string?
phrase = 'red,green,blue'. Split this string by commas.
data = 'name:John,age:30,city:New York'. Split this data first by commas then by colons.
text = 'Python-Programming-Language'. Split this string using the hyphen as a delimiter.
sentence = 'The   quick  brown fox'. What happens when split() is used on a string with multiple spaces?
text = 'hello.world.python'. Split this string at each period.
date = '2023-04-15'. Split this date into year, month, and day components.
text = 'Python is fun'. Split this string and then rejoin it with hyphens.
filename = 'document.pdf'. Split this filename to separate the name from the extension.
csv_line = '1,John,Smith,30,New York'. Split and extract only the name portions.
sentence = 'I love Python programming!'. Split this into words and convert each to uppercase.
log_entry = 'INFO:2023-04-15:System started'. Extract the log level, date, and message.
url = 'https://www.example.com/products?id=1234'. Extract the domain and parameters.
text = 'Python,Java;C++;JavaScript,Ruby'. Split this string with multiple different delimiters.
path = '/home/user/documents/file.txt'. Extract all directory names and the filename.
names = 'John, Mary; Bob, Alice; Sam, Tom'. Extract each individual name as a separate item.
text = 'key1=value1;key2=value2;key3=value3'. Create a dictionary-like structure from this string.
